intro: Myrsine memaoyaensis, commonly known as the Memaoya myrsine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is a shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are arranged in clusters, often with two or three stamens.
